body.p: The plugin is distributed in any of the oXygen distributions. The plugin id is: com.oxygenxml.pdf.css and it is installed in the [OXYGEN-INSTALL-DIR]frameworks/dita/DITA-OT2.x/plugins/com.oxygenxml.pdf.css folder.

It works by:
Expanding all the topic references into a temporary clone of the map, resolving key and reused content. This is the standad DITA-OT preprocessing.
Generating structures for the table of contents and index. The result is a merged map with all the refernces resolved. This is a standad DITA-OT processing based on the PDF2 plugin.
Post-process the merged map: fix some structure in the TOC and index, move frontmatter, backmatter to the correct places, transform the oXygen change tracking and review processing instructions to elements that can be styled later, etc.. The result is another merged map.
In the last phase it uses a collection of CSS files to style the merged map with the help of the CSS processor. Some of the CSS files are selected by the dropdown Styles from the editor interface and they are processed together with the args.css parameter set in the transformation scenario.
The process uses a series of stylesheets to tweak the merged map to a form that can be easily styled using CSS.
